locations.name: Piazza Duomo
locations.description:
Trento’s Piazza Duomo is the buzzing heart of this city, the capital of the Trentino region. Duomo in Italian means Cathedral, and Trento’s Cathedral San Vigilio does indeed dominate the square, but there are lots of things that are equally important and interesting to see in this square.
The square from the middle-ages onwards became home to the civic and religious administration of the city, although before 1000 a.d it was an area beyond the city’s walls. The outward expansion of the city centred on this area, around a church dedicated to the city’s patron St. Vigilius, and with the construction of the Palazzo Pretorio and the Duomo it cemented its position as the main square of the city.

locations.name: Palazzo della Provincia
locations.description:
Located inside the Palace of the Autonomous Province of Trento overlooking Piazza Dante, Sala Depero was in the past a sumptuous dining room of the Imperial Hotel Trento, then it became the seat of art exhibitions from the late twenties.
It owes its name to Fortunato Depero, an artist from Rovereto (painter, sculptor and advertising) who, between 1953 and 1956, turned it into a work of art performing there his land in a colourful harmony combining futurism, cubism and abstract art . The decor was inspired by the movements of the Mitteleuropa aesthetics, born in the mid-nineteenth century, which had their maximum and most mature expression in the first two decades of the twentieth century, particularly the Secession of Vienna. All revisited and mitigated with an Italian taste that reduces its grandeur. The manufacture was entrusted to local artisans. From 1948 to 1960, it hosted the sessions of the provincial Council and the regional one.
The entrance from Piazza Dante has steps, while from Via Vannetti is barrier-free (ramp of 303cm with a difference in height of 6.6% and a bell height of 119cm). On the floor of the porter's lodge, there are Sala Depero and the toilets with grab bars on both sides of the toilet (door width: 90cm, internal dimensions 180x200cm, toilet 50cm high). The Braille push-button lift (door width 90cm, dimensions 137x150) allows to reach the various floors of the building. Five parking areas reserved for people with disabilities in via Gazzoletti.

locations.name: Teatro Sociale
locations.description:
The charm of this place is not only linked to the beauty of a 'real' theater, but in large part to the suggestions that it manages to evoke thanks to its history that begins on May 29, 1819 with the staging of 'La Cenerentola' by Gioachino Rossini. The theater was called Teatro Mazzurana, named after Felice Mazzurana, promoter of the construction and first owner. In 1835 the entrepreneur-coffee maker sold the property and the Theater changed its name to Teatro Sociale, run by the Theater Company. In nineteenth-century Trento, the Teatro Sociale was the driving force of an intense cultural activity, hosting events that went from opera to prose, from dance to classical music, but was also used for political meetings, balls, magic shows. 
La Platea, three floors of boxes and the gallery as well as 3 rooms used for meetings and conferences, make it a multifaceted structure suitable for any type of representation or event. It can be walked along the entire perimeter with places reserved for disabled people in the first rows. The elevator (door width: 100cm, dimensions 150x180 cm) allows you to reach the Volkenstein hall and Palazzo Festi; the stage can be reached by a step from the back of the building. On the ground floor there are the toilets equipped with grab bars on both sides of the toilet (door width 93 cm, internal dimensions 280x200 cm, height 50 cm). Parking reserved for people with disabilities located at 50 meters from the theater along Via Manci.

locations.name: Castello del Buonconsiglio
locations.description:
The Buonconsiglio Castle is the largest and most important monumental complex of the Trentino Alto Adige region. It was the residence of the prince-bishops of Trento from the 13th century to the end of the 18th century, and is composed of a series of buildings of different eras, enclosed by walls and positioned slightly higher than the city. Castelvecchio is the oldest nucleus, dominated by an imposing cylindrical tower; the Magno Palazzo is the 16th century expansion in the Italian Renaissance-style as commissioned by the Prince-Bishop and Cardinal Bernardo Cles (1485-1539); the Baroque-style Giunta Albertiana dates from the end of the 17th century.
The Marangonerie Room hosted the Historical Museum in Trento from 1985 until 2003. Currently, in addition to the bookshop, in the hall there is a first information point about the four sites of the museum. The sizeof the room allows it to be used for conferences, meetings, as well as, naturally, to be an exhibition space for temporary exhibitions. The parking spaces reserved for people with disabilities can be found in Piazza della Mostra.

locations.name: Palazzo Geremia
locations.description:
This palace is one of the most important secular monuments in the city. Its architectonic structure is double-faced: clearly Renaissance on the outside looking onto Via Belenzani and late Gothic on the inside. Thus, it is an expression of the change from Gothic to Renaissance and is influenced by both the Lombard and the Veneto art. 
Built between the end of the 15th century and the first years of the 16th by order of Giovanni Antonio Pona, known as Geremia, son of Geremia Pona, a citizen of Trento belonging to a family from Verona, it seems that Pona used free workmen who were active in Trento at that time.

locations.name: Cinema Modena
locations.description:
The Cinema Theater Gustavo Modena of Trento - named after the great nineteenth-century actor originally from Mori - was founded in 1911 thanks to the entrepreneurial initiative of Giuseppe Lazzeri who created a popular open-air theater, building a stage overlooking a large square where, under a large tarpaulin to shelter from the frequent summer rains, the spectators sat on wooden benches. The project was drafted by a Viennese architect who conceived a dome-shaped roof supported by arches made of fine wooden trellis (1912). The original structure, although modified several times in the superstructures, was maintained until 1997, when, with the total elimination, in the record time of 11 months, it was reached the current three screens giving rise to the first real multiplex in the region, very modern and technologically advanced. 
A ramp of 20m with a difference in height of 19% leads to the entrance to the cinema, where a door with manual opening towards the outside is placed (246cm wide, 105cm high, force required to open it: 2kg). Three tiered screening rooms allow wheelchair users to stop in the last row. There are toilets with grab bars on both sides of the toilet (90cm door, internal space 183x183cm, height 46cm). In Via San Francesco d'Assisi there is a car park reserved for people with disabilities.

locations.name: UNITN - Department of Economics and Management
locations.displayString: UNITN - Department of Economics and Management - Conference Hall
locations.description:
The Department is the outgrowth of the Faculty of Economics and Commerce, which was founded in Trento in 1973. As a new academic institution, it brought together the two historical branches of Economics (DECO) and Informatics and Business Studies (DISA). The Department (DEM) is actively involved in numerous fields of economic and management research and its members have intrinsically diverse interests – from the theoretical to the empirical, quantitative to experimental, and case study analysis to computer simulations. DEM hosts a multidisciplinary research environment where academics apply a wide array of methodologies. 
Possibility to enter the Department of Economics and Management from via Rosmini with platform (105x143 cm, door 80 cm); regularly paved outdoor garden. Presence of ramps with variable slope from a minimum of 7.5% to a maximum of 10%, for lengths from 74 cm to 1000 cm. On the ground floor near the entrance: reception (counter 115 cm high) and ATM (125 cm high). The conference room on the ground floor is accessible, the stage can be reached with a 135 cm long slide and a 25.3% slope. Sala Soppalco reachable with stairlift (85x80 capacity 130 kg). All floors are accessible and all classrooms are accessible; in some rooms there are steps, with the possibility of stopping in the first row or in the upper part of the stalls. In the equipped toilets grab bars are placed on both sides (50 cm high). The parking spaces reserved for people with disabilities can be found in via Inama, other 3 stalls in the underground car park.

locations.name: Bruno Kessler Foundation
locations.description:
Top Research Institute in Italy, ranked at the 1st place for scientific excellence within 3 different subject areas (ICT, History and Sociology) and for the economic and social impact according to the quality of research ANVUR evaluation for the period 2010-2014.
Fondazione Bruno Kessler is a research non-profit public interest entity.
Being the result of a history that is more than half a century old, through 2 scientific hubs, 7 research centres, 410 researchers, 2 specialized libraries, 7 laboratories, FBK aims to results of excellence in science and technology with particular emphasis on interdisciplinary approaches and to the applicative dimension.
We achieve this thanks to our constant attention to collaborations and exchange activities with research organizations, both institutional and corporate, national and international, which extend our innovation capability and involve the community and the local economy in the circulation of knowledge and technologies.

locations.name: Sala Filarmonica
locations.description:
Fondata nel 1795 la Società Filarmonica di Trento fino al 1905 svolse la propria attività in vari palazzi della città. L'edificio dove si trova attualmente fu portato a termine in un anno, e inaugurato con un concerto diretto dal M.o Vincenzo Gianferrari il 30 maggio 1905. La struttura del palazzo comprende un sotterraneo, un piano rialzato con otto stanze e un appartamentino per il portiere, la Sala da concerti con due salette di servizio al primo piano, tre stanze con cinque loggette verso la parte alta della Sala al terzo piano. Salvo pochissime modifiche la palazzina si presenta tuttora come venne costruita nel 1905.
Pregevole il portone d'entrata in rovere massiccio che emerge in mezzo ad una facciata bugnata, realizzata con un modernissimo conglomerato cementizio; elegante lo scalone d'accesso alla Sala dei concerti, illuminata da sette ampie serliane, dove sopra il palcoscenico posto sulla parete ad est fa bella figura l'organo costruito dalla ditta Vegezzi-Bossi nel 1906. All'esterno fa bella figura il finestrone centrale col suo frontone triangolare finemente decorato a bassorilievo con soggetti musicali.

locations.name: Municipal Library
locations.description: In pieno centro storico, tra via Torre Vanga e via Pozzo, con ingresso su via Roma, la biblioteca comunale di Trento si trova nel palazzo dell'ex Collegio dei Gesuiti cui si è aggiunta nel 1990 la bella sala liberty (Sala Manzoni). L'atto fondativo della biblioteca comunale di Trento, ufficialmente aperta al pubblico il primo gennaio 1856 - periodo in cui Trento e il Trentino facevano parte del Land del Tirolo con capoluogo Innsbruck - può essere individuato nel testamento del vescovo Giovanni Benedetto Gentilotti che donò i diecimila volumi della sua cospicua libreria, raccolti nel corso di una lunga attività di studioso, bibliotecario e collezionista svolta fra Salisburgo, Vienna e Roma. La biblioteca comunale di Trento è dunque sorta come istituzione deputata alla memoria e alla documentazione della cultura (italiana) del territorio. Ai fondi librari antichi e recenti si affiancano interi archivi o singoli documenti (e tra questi anche, dal 1876, lo stesso archivio storico comunale) e oggetti d'arte 'per servire alla storia ecclesiastica, civile e letteraria del Vescovado e Principato di Trento e del Concilio ecumenico celebrato in quella città'. Il portone d'ingresso della biblioteca comunale è largo 216 cm, alto 138cm e necessita della forza di 4kg per aprirlo. Servizi igienici, raggiungibili tramite rampa lunga 8,24m con pendenza del 6,5%, presentano maniglioni di sostegno su entrambe i lati del wc (porta da 89cm, musure stanza interna 175x169cm, altezza wc 46cm). Parcheggio riservato a persone con disabilità, in via Roma.

locations.name: Franco Demarchi Foundation
locations.description: Born as evolution and development of the Regional Institute of Studies and Social Research; The Demarchi Foundation aims to promote and carry out training and research in the social, educational and cultural fields for the benefit of local communities and their development. It also deals with training activities, continuous training and education and lifelong learning.

locations.name: Palazzo Bassetti
locations.description:
Palazzo Bassetti is now home to Intesa Sanpaolo, formerly the headquarters of the Banca di Trento and Bolzano since 1960. Once home to the Barons Bassetti, it was renovated by Eng. Saverio Tamanini (1833-1887), 'cultured and gentle spirit, artist of exquisite taste', one of the most famous professionals involved in the development of the city in the second half of the 19th century.  The BTB inaugurates the new salon in 1961 and restructures the entire building in 2000 (design by the architect Sergio Giovanazzi). 
The conference room, located on the fourth floor, can be reached by elevator (75cm wide door, 289x279cm size). The speakers area has an 18 cm high step. The toilets equipped with grab bars on the side (47 cm high) are located on the ground floor. Other equipped toilets are present near the conference room (220x173 cm, door 80 cm, toilet 46 cm high with grab bars on both sides). In via Manci, parking spaces reserved for people with disabilities.

locations.name: Auditorium Santa Chiara
locations.description: Il complesso del Centro Servizi Culturali S. Chiara, oltre ad ospitare le Stagioni dei Teatri, è un importante struttura per attività congressuali, potendo disporre di attrezzature avanzate e di spazi espositivi.Situato nei pressi del centro storico di Trento, offre tutti i servizi di organizzazione congressuale. E’ facilmente raggiungibile dagli alberghi della città, nonchè dalla stazione ferroviaria e dall’autostrada.Il Centro Servizi Culturali S. Chiara è un ente pubblico economico, istituito con la Legge Provinciale n.37 del 1988. Le sue finalità, stabilite all’art. 1 di tale legge sono: 'la gestione coordinata del complesso ex Santa Chiara e del Teatro Sociale di Trento, nonché di altre strutture culturali di rilevanza provinciale, assicurandone altresì il più razionale ed economico utilizzo...' .Entrando più nello specifico, sempre dall’art. 1 della legge istitutiva : '...assume ed organizza la realizzazione, di norma nelle predette strutture, di manifestazioni e attività teatrali, musicali, cinematografiche, audiovisive e culturali in genere, su incarico del Comune di Trento e di altri comuni ...assume ed organizza, su incarico e finanziamento della Provincia e di altri enti pubblici o privati la realizzazione di manifestazioni e iniziative culturali di rilevanza provinciale.

locations.name: Department of Humanities and Philosophy
locations.description: The Department of Humanities and Philosophy is based in via Tommaso Gar n. 14. It is located in the historic center, a few hundred meters from Piazza Duomo and can be reached in about 5 minutes on foot from the train and bus station.

locations.name: Department of Sociology
locations.description: The inner courtyard of the department is paved in pebbles with porphyry lanes; inside the structure, in addition to the 127 cm entrance ramp with a gradient of 8.4%, there are other ramps from a minimum of 5.4% to a maximum of 13.9%, for lengths from 30 cm to 695 cm. The concierge, some offices and part of the laboratories can be reached by lift and by stair lift (75x80 capacity 230 kg). Access to the Kessler classroom with a 130 cm wide door, accessible throughout its perimeter with the exception of the final steps. Places reserved for people with disabilities in the first rows. The speakers area of the hall can be reached by an elevating platform (90x120) preceded by a 40 cm long ramp with a gradient of 20.2%. The toilets, equipped with grab bars on the opposite side (53 cm high), are on the first and second floor. Parking spaces reserved for people with disabilities can be found in via Verdi and via Maffei.

locations.name: OECD Offices
locations.displayString: Convent of San Marco - OECD Offices
locations.description:
The convent of S. Marco, now home to the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development, originates from the permission to establish an Augustinian settlement in the city in a place that was then at the edge of the urban center and near the Castle, granted in 1271 to the small community of Emeritan friars that had already been installed in Barbaniga di Civezzano during the first decades of the 13th century. As a result of the third French invasion, in 1809, Trento was annexed to the Italic Kingdom and the Augustinians were ordered to evacuate the Convent of San Marco, which became the headquarters of the Finance and State Property Office. 
Floor in cobblestone. The entrance door of the former convent has a 145 cm wide automatic opening. The rooms and offices can be reached via steps; the gardens, with a floor in cobblestones and grass, are free of barriers. Two parking spaces reserved for people with disabilities in via San Marco.

locations.name: Facoltà di Giurisprudenza - Aula B
locations.description: L'Aula B si trova nel piano interrato della Facoltà ed ha 175 posti a sedere. Predisposta per traduzione simultanea, sala regia,impianti audio-video, telecamera a circuito chiuso e per videoconferenza - collegamenti telefonici, internet. Nella Facoltà sono presenti ascensori dislocati in più punti che permettono di raggiungere tutti i piani. Presenza di rampe interne ed esterne con pendenza dal 6.3% al 7.7% e lunghezza da un minimo di 355 cm ad un massimo di 395 cm. I servizi igienici a piano terra sono attrezzati con maniglioni su entrambe i lati del wc (alto 49 cm).  I parcheggi riservati a persone con disabilità sono in via Verdi e in via Rosmini.

locations.name: School of Law - Great Hall
locations.description:
The Conference Hall of the Faculty of Law was inaugurated in October 2006 in the new wing designed along Via Rosmini by architect Mario Botta. With its 370 seats overall is the ideal venue for conferences and events of the faculty but also of the university. Modern and versatile, it can be divided into two separate classrooms through a sliding wall. It is equipped with a cabin for simultaneous translation, a control room and complete with audio video systems, CCTV cameras and videoconferencing facilities, telephone connections and the Internet. The new headquarters also features a large hall where the faculty reception is located, a cloakroom and a space for organizing coffee breaks and buffet lunches. 
The Great Hall has steps 12.5 cm high and 97 cm deep; the speakers area is not accessible. There are elevators located in several points of the Faculty that allow you to reach all floors. Presence of internal and external ramps with slope from 6.3% to 7.7% and length from a minimum of 355 cm to a maximum of 395 cm. The toilets on the ground floor are equipped with grab bars on both sides (49 cm high). On all floors there are dedicated bathrooms. Parking spaces reserved for people with disabilities are in via Verdi and via Rosmini.

locations.name: MUSE
locations.description:
The Autonomous Province of Trento asked starchitect Renzo Piano to create in a disused industrial area of approximately 19,000 sqm not just a museum, but a place to reflect on the relationship between nature and man. That is how the MUSE was born - so successful that it was the only museum in Italy to be awarded an honourable mention at the European Museum of the Year Awards 2015.
From the mountains to the challenges of sustainability, from the first men on Earth to the DNA’s secrets. With “special effects” to experience virtually the same emotions of a climb on the Dolomites walls or a downhill skiing descent.A very real experience, however, is touching with your own hand fossils and minerals, using the microscope and going into the large greenhouse with living plants from the Tanzania forest.
And more, the dinosaurs of the Alpine region, their footprints, the first painted stones and the weapons of prehistoric hunters in the ice age. In a science gym you can learn the principles of physics and mechanics with the help of interactive installations.

locations.name: Palazzo Calepini
locations.description:
In the heart of the historic center, behind the Cathedral of Trento, on the corner between Via Calepina and Via Garibaldi, Palazzo Calepini was for decades the headquarters of the Istituto di Credito Fondiario of Trentino Alto Adige. Now owned by the Cassa di Risparmio Foundation of Trento and Rovereto, the Palazzo is used as its registered and administrative office. A recent renovation has canceled the pre-existing 'banking' structure of the ground floor, leaving space for a large and modern conference room, with 150 seats and equipped with cutting-edge technology that makes it suitable for hosting conferences,  symposia, round tables, etc. 
The entrance door is always open and followed by a counter-door with a 120cm wide automatic opening (on request, access without barriers from Via Dordi, 8). The toilets have a grab bar on the side (43 cm high). Reserved parking for people with disabilities is located in Via Calepina.

locations.name: Palazzo della Regione
locations.description: L'attuale palazzo sede della Regione Autonoma Trentino Alto Adige è sorto sulle rovine dell'ex casa 'Caneppele' (1877) che venne colpita dai bombardamenti della seconda guerra mondiale quando ospitava la sede trentina della Banca d'Italia. Nel dopoguerra gli uffici dell'Amministrazione Regionale erano dislocati in sette diversi edifici pertanto allo scopo di dare una unica e organica sede ai suoi servizi la Giunta Regionale nel 1953 ritenne opportuno bandire un concorso nazionale per la progettazione di una nuova sede. A conclusione del concorso nell'estate del 1954 venne proclamato vincitore, tra i più di cinquanta progetti presentati, quello dell'architetto trentino Adalberto Libera (1903-1963) esponente di spicco dell'architettura razionalista italiana dell'epoca che aveva precedentemente progettato, a Trento, le scuole Sanzio (1931-1934) e un edificio INA in via Galilei (1949). La costruzione realizzata tra gli anni 1958-65 venne affidata alla Garboli di Roma che si avvalse della collaborazione in subappalto di numerose imprese specialistiche anche locali. La direzione dei lavori venne svolta dall'Ufficio Tecnico della Regione diretto dall'Ing. Arch. Ezio Miorelli L'attuale edificio pur rispettando le linee architettoniche e i rapporti volumetrici fondamentali del progetto vincitore del concorso di progettazione venne rielaborato nella fase esecutiva per adempiere più strettamente alle necessità operative degli uffici regionali del tempo. Il complesso si articola in tre volumi fondamentali caratterizzati ciascuno da diversa forma e dimensione quasi ad evidenziarne la diversa funzionalità: * Il corpo Giunta, che ospita gli uffici della presidenza sia della Giunta che del Consiglio, prospicente Piazza Dante, caratterizzato da un volume regolare a pianta rettangolare sospeso su eleganti colonne in calcestruzzo armato a sezione paraboloide con il sottostante porticato e ingresso limitato da un ampia parete vetrata e con gli altri prospetti in calcestruzzo a vista e rivestimenti lapidei; * Il corpo Assessorati, che ospita gli uffici amministrativi, dislocato lungo via Gazzoletti realizzato con il sistema della facciata continua in metallo e staticamente definito da una serie di pilastri ad albero che ne risolvono la funzione portante definendo una zona a portico lungo la via stessa; * Il Parlamentino, definito da una struttura a tronco di cono rovesciato che si eleva, dal cortile interno definito dai due precedenti volumi, che ospita l'aula del Consiglio Regionale e una grande sala di rappresentanza situata al piano terra con ingresso diretto da piazza Dante. L’atrio dell’edificio del corpo Assessorati con ingresso diretto da via Gazzoletti 2, è uno splendido luogo, dove vengono ospitati con garbo e discrezione gli espositori. Lungo le vetrate il visitatore, dall’esterno del palazzo, potrà ammirare i numerosi pezzi esposti sotto la sapiente guida della Segreteria della Giunta regionale.

locations.name: Sede RAI Trento
locations.description: L'attuale palazzo sede della Regione Autonoma Trentino Alto Adige è sorto sulle rovine dell'ex casa 'Caneppele' (1877) che venne colpita dai bombardamenti della seconda guerra mondiale quando ospitava la sede trentina della Banca d'Italia. Nel dopoguerra gli uffici dell'Amministrazione Regionale erano dislocati in sette diversi edifici pertanto allo scopo di dare una unica e organica sede ai suoi servizi la Giunta Regionale nel 1953 ritenne opportuno bandire un concorso nazionale per la progettazione di una nuova sede. A conclusione del concorso nell'estate del 1954 venne proclamato vincitore, tra i più di cinquanta progetti presentati, quello dell'architetto trentino Adalberto Libera (1903-1963) esponente di spicco dell'architettura razionalista italiana dell'epoca che aveva precedentemente progettato, a Trento, le scuole Sanzio (1931-1934) e un edificio INA in via Galilei (1949). La costruzione realizzata tra gli anni 1958-65 venne affidata alla Garboli di Roma che si avvalse della collaborazione in subappalto di numerose imprese specialistiche anche locali. La direzione dei lavori venne svolta dall'Ufficio Tecnico della Regione diretto dall'Ing. Arch. Ezio Miorelli L'attuale edificio pur rispettando le linee architettoniche e i rapporti volumetrici fondamentali del progetto vincitore del concorso di progettazione venne rielaborato nella fase esecutiva per adempiere più strettamente alle necessità operative degli uffici regionali del tempo. Il complesso si articola in tre volumi fondamentali caratterizzati ciascuno da diversa forma e dimensione quasi ad evidenziarne la diversa funzionalità: * Il corpo Giunta, che ospita gli uffici della presidenza sia della Giunta che del Consiglio, prospicente Piazza Dante, caratterizzato da un volume regolare a pianta rettangolare sospeso su eleganti colonne in calcestruzzo armato a sezione paraboloide con il sottostante porticato e ingresso limitato da un ampia parete vetrata e con gli altri prospetti in calcestruzzo a vista e rivestimenti lapidei; * Il corpo Assessorati, che ospita gli uffici amministrativi, dislocato lungo via Gazzoletti realizzato con il sistema della facciata continua in metallo e staticamente definito da una serie di pilastri ad albero che ne risolvono la funzione portante definendo una zona a portico lungo la via stessa; * Il Parlamentino, definito da una struttura a tronco di cono rovesciato che si eleva, dal cortile interno definito dai due precedenti volumi, che ospita l'aula del Consiglio Regionale e una grande sala di rappresentanza situata al piano terra con ingresso diretto da piazza Dante. L’atrio dell’edificio del corpo Assessorati con ingresso diretto da via Gazzoletti 2, è uno splendido luogo, dove vengono ospitati con garbo e discrezione gli espositori. Lungo le vetrate il visitatore, dall’esterno del palazzo, potrà ammirare i numerosi pezzi esposti sotto la sapiente guida della Segreteria della Giunta regionale.

sessions.description: [TESTO ITALIANO] The keynote kicks off on November 7 at 10AM PST, where you'll hear directly from Dave Burke and others on the present and future of Android development.
sessions.title: Keynote

sessions.description: The release of androidx.test v1.0 makes testing a first class citizen of Android developer tools. See how a new set of cross platform APIs enable you to write both unit and integration tests that run in any environment and learn of our upcoming plans for future releases.
sessions.title: Testing Rebooted (with AndroidX Test)

organizers.bio: Izabela has been a Software Engineer on the Android Studio team for 2 years. She works on the Android Gradle Plugin and her main areas of expertise include resources and AAPT2 support. Beside being an engineer, Iza is also a diversity and inclusion activist.
organizers.name: Izabela Orlowska

organizers.bio:
Chris works as a software engineer at Google, working on the Android Gradle Plugin, first in Mountain View and now in London.
Prior to joining Google, Chris worked as a Research Assistant in the Security Group of the The Computer Laboratory, University of Cambridge. He previously studied computer science as undergraduate at the University of Cambridge.
organizers.name: Chris Warrington
